intro: Orophea brandisii, commonly known as the Brandis's starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded forest environments. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. However, it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and over-collection.
